title: Advanced Vocabulary and Grammar Quiz (Part 2)
description: Continue to challenge yourself with this advanced vocabulary and grammar quiz. Test your knowledge of word usage, adverb placement, spelling, parallel structure, and more to enhance your language skills.

items.question: Identify the correct usage of the word 'querulous' in a sentence.
choices: Her querulous tone conveyed annoyance.
The garden was filled with querulous flowers.
He solved the problem with a querulous approach.
Querulously, he accepted the challenge.

items.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of the word 'jejune':
choices: The meal was jejune, lacking in flavor.
She presented a jejune argument.
Jejune clouds covered the sky.
His jejune personality made him popular.
items.answer: The meal was jejune, lacking in flavor.

items.question: Identify the correct spelling of the word meaning 'to make a harsh sound'?
choices: Grate
Great
Greatt
Grait

items.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of the adverb 'tacitly':
choices: He tacitly agreed to the terms.
The tacitly agreement was signed.
Tacitly, she whispered the secret.
Tacitly accepting, the decision was made.
items.answer: He tacitly agreed to the terms.

items.question: Identify the correct form of the irregular verb 'drive' in the past perfect tense.
choices: Driven
Drove
Drived
Drave

items.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of the word 'obfuscate':
choices: The clear instructions helped, not obfuscated.
Obfuscate language can be confusing.
Obfuscating the issue clarified things.
The obfuscation made the point clear.

items.question: Identify the correct sentence with a proper parallel structure:
choices: She likes hiking, running, and to swim.
He enjoys playing tennis, reading, and hiking.
To dance, singing, and painting are her hobbies.
I like swimming, to hike, and playing tennis.
items.answer: He enjoys playing tennis, reading, and hiking.

items.question: What is the correct plural form of 'syllabus'?
choices: Syllabi
Syllabuses
Syllabusses
Syllabii

items.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of the semicolon:
choices: She traveled to Paris, London, and Rome; she loved Europe.
He was tired; he decided to take a nap.
They studied all night; however, the exam was challenging.
The dog barked loudly, and the cat jumped; scared.
items.answer: She traveled to Paris, London, and Rome; she loved Europe.

items.question: Identify the correct use of the word 'languish' in a sentence.
choices: The flowers languished in the sunlight.
He showed a languish interest in the topic.
Languish fruits were picked from the tree.
Her languish attitude brightened the room.
items.answer: The flowers languished in the sunlight.
